Gender and Women's Studies     Search the site     Toggle Menu      Search                  Gender and Women's Studies      Gender and Women's Studies   Main Menu    About           GWS History    News    Books from GWS Alumni    Contact Us         Students           For Students    Undergraduate Studies    Graduate Studies    Courses    GWS Student Funding Opportunities         People           Core Faculty    Affiliated Faculty    Emeriti Faculty    Lecturers    Administration         Events           Civic Engagement, Community Service, and Community Organizing (CECSCO) Awards         Resources During COVID-19           Student Resources    Resources for Virtual Learning    Wellness    General COVID-19 Resources and Guides    Feminist Writings, Collective Work, and Movements          Eyebrow menu    las.uic.edu    +Give    UIC menu    UIC.edu    Campus Map       Search                               College Of  Liberal Arts  And  Sciences        Gender and Women's Studies  Gender and Women's Studies                    Gender and Womens Studies        About GWS  The Gender and Women’s Studies (GWS) Program at the University of Illinois at Chicago is a vibrant interdisciplinary department made up of scholars who study a wide range of topics critical to an expansive understanding of how and why gender and sexuality matter in the world.       Academic Programs  The Gender and Women's Studies Program offers a Major and Minor in Gender and Women's Studies as well as a Minor in Social Justice. GWS also offers a Graduate Concentration Certificate.       Meet GWS!  Learn more about our amazing faculty and students here.       Events  Learn more about Gender and Women’s Studies events!          GWS Quote    The way to right wrongs is to turn the light of truth upon them.    Ida B.
